title: Dylan Hartley interview: 'The media has built an aura for the All Blacks. England's players will not buy into it'
text:
Former captain Dylan Hartley believes England will foster an unshakeable confidence that they can overturn New Zealand and reach the Rugby World Cup final, with “brilliant” head coach and mentor Eddie Jones integral to forging that mentality over the past four years.

Hartley, who has not played since Northampton Saints’ 32-6 win over Worcester Warriors on December 21 last year, was ruled out of England’s World Cup campaign in the summer prior to the squad’s pre-season schedule.

Although the 33 year-old hooker admitted to feeling “bloody bored” of the rehabilitation process, he is making “small progress” on the road back to playing.

Forced to watch on as England have reached the last four in Japan...
description: Former captain Dylan Hartley believes England will foster an unshakeable confidence that they can overturn New Zealand and reach the Rugby World Cup final, with “brilliant” head coach and mentor Eddie Jones integral to forging that mentality over the past four years.
